topics.name: Music Teachers Talking about Teaching Music

results.description: For anyone with a 21st century view of music education... spiritual meets 'business mind' outlook. We want to avoid competitive training and promote co-operative collaboration and mutual support. Our desire is to be quite unique...to be VERY different than the stereotype that music educators often seem to portray. Check out (info@beyondrock.org) (facebook.com/beyondrockcamp). That 2-4 week summer program is a model of something 'truly' unique. We desire a year round expansion of that program...this is our ultimate goal... classes, lessons, diverse workshops, showcases, etc.  Anyone who wants to serve kids/teens with teaching and coaching rock/pop/alternative/hip-hop/etc. music (as primary) but ALSO in various other areas... conflict resolution, acceptance of new ideas, theater improv therapy (through theater games), yoga, an array of creative activities and community and confidence reinforcement. Helping kids/teens "step outside their comfort zones" with no fear of judgement. The teaching is one thing and takes exceptional people... still, it's the skilled, strategic, pro-active, organization, directorship and management part that is the really tough part.  It takes the combination of educator, humanitarian and entrepreneur to implement such a mission. With all participants from administration to volunteers to equipment setup to instructors...we absolutely prefer the concept of the 'work WITH' mentality...we're not all that fond of the term 'work FOR'. A socialistic, democratic angle to building a company...perhaps...but it seems to work amazingly well with Beyond Rock. A feeling of ownership is essential to develop passion in an individual. That said, obviously there still needs to be an agreement on philosophy and mission and those individuals who thoughtfully plan & guide - leading the course of events. They need to be sharp, very pro-active, extraordinarily communicative (staff, parents, students) and decisive.
results.name: Business Entrepreneurs With Music Education in Mind

Have you been craving true love, a long-term relationship, soulmate love and/or lasting love? Have you noticed patterns in your relationships that you'd like to change? Hello Telugu folks,

Surprised to know that there is no telugu group for people living in NJ/NY inspite of being in large numbers. This meetup group is for all telugu people living in NY/NJ who love to hangout with fellow telugu people in and around New York City.

The idea is to have best of both the worlds, all the incredible things about India in addition to the beautiful varied culture and international experience that New York can offer! We want it all! The main agenda is to arrange plenty of activities to socialize and mingle with like minded people over evening drinks, dinners and movies.

We love Telugu Movies and the buzz around our premier shows. We love Bollywood nights and can dance all night long. We love hanging out in happy hours. We love roaming around the city, planning day trips and adventure activities. We love Hyderabadi Biryani, Spicy food , potlucks and all our festivals. We love Cricket.

People with similar interests go ahead and join the meetup. We want this to be perfect meeting place be it for socialize/social networking or for somebody who wants to enjoy a weekend beyond just plain dining at some Indian restaurant.

Members are welcome to bring their non-Telugu speaking friends/partners to events.

Note: This is not dating meetup. The core of the group is genuinely cool, cultured & super liberal without any hidden agenda or judgement and we seek the same in you!

========================================================

results.description:
Pearson Technology Group NYC LiveLessons Workshops

LiveLessons Workshops are day-long technology training events. They take place in the Pearson building at 330 Hudson Street. They cover a range of computer science and engineering topics, including programming languages, agile software development methodologies, mobile application development, web application development, and more. 

Presenters are leading members of the technical community, including many authors from Pearson's Addison-Wesley and Prentice Hall Professional publishing imprints.

All LiveLessons Workshops are FREE to attend, and all are filmed. Attendees are required to sign a video release form before attending. Space is always limited. 

About LiveLessons Workshops:

- All events take place at the Pearson building in lower Manhattan located at 330 Hudson St, NY, NY 10013.

- Events generally take place from 10 AM - 5 PM. 

 - All LiveLessons Workshops are filmed and published as part of PTG's LiveLessons video training series. All event participants are required to sign an on-camera release form. 

- All LiveLessons Workshops allow members of our community to interact with one another, learn from industry leading experts and build relationships with likewise minded persons to better personal and professional tech skills. 

 About Pearson:

Pearson is the world's leading learning company, with 40,000 employees in more than 80 countries working to help people of all ages make measurable progress in their lives through learning. Pearson provides learning materials, places of learning, technologies, assessments and services to teachers, professionals and students in order to help people everywhere aim higher and fulfill their true potential.

About PTG:

PTG, the Pearson Technology Group, is the world's leading publisher of computer science and technology books, eBooks, videos and web-based learning materials. PTG's many imprints include Addison-Wesley Professional, Prentice Hall Professional, Sams, Cisco Press, and Pearson IT Certification.
results.name: Pearson NYC LiveLessons Workshops - Technology Training

Event Location:
Days Hotel Conference Center
195 Rt. 18 South, East Brunswick, NJ 08816
732-828-6900

The Breakfast Club NJ - 10 Points for Good Member Citizenship

1) Attend meetings regularly to keep group strong and help pay back to others (meeting logistics on our website www.thebreakfastclubnj.com)

2) Keep anti-virus on your machine up to date and run scan regularly

3) Review messages and if request for assistance please help whenever possible

4) Join groups linked in group and connect to other members directly (questions see Gerry Peyton)

5) Join groups Facebook group and Google+ group and connect to other members directly (questions see Adrienne Roman)

6) Join groups twitter account (questions see George Pace)

7) If you run across someone in transition invite them to join our group and sponsor them through process (details on our website www.thebreakfastclubnj.com)

8) Sunday mornings listen to our radio show, "Your Career Is Calling", at 8am ET either on radio at 107.7 or via internet 24/7 live or on demand at www.1077thebronc.com (as this is a call in show your calls help make it successful)

9) If you are in transition put your elevator pitch in writing to group, ask for help with job search issues or connecting to people at target companies, regularly post job opportunities (from email you joined the group - send email to thebreakfastclubnj@yahoogroups.com)

10) Help fellow members whenever possible

Information on “The Breakfast Club NJ”: (www.thebreakfastclubnj.com)
There is information below on the location, other information, etc. Thanks to the generosity of one of our members, The Breakfast Club NJ will be free for 2015. Additionally, that member is providing free bagels to the first 50 attendees each month!
Go to http://www.thebreakfastclubnj.com/ for more information and how to join the Yahoo group. You can join the yahoo group at any time; you do not need to have attended a meeting. You can also attend meetings at any time without having joined the yahoo group.
If you have any questions, please let me know (brian.mecca@yahoo.com) or send an email to Info@thebreakfastclubnj.com
We look forward to seeing everyone let's make this a great meeting for our members that are in transition and welcome those that have landed

Meeting Format:
7:30 to 8:00 – Registration & Open Networking
8:00 to 8:15 - Welcome and housekeeping
8:15 to 9:15 – Presentation by the guest speaker – Limited to 60 minutes
9:15 to 10:15 - Elevator Pitch - 30 Seconds about yourself, who you are, what you are looking for, target companies (3-4), how we can help you, how you can help others. Follow the rule of the Three B’s of Public Speaking: Be informative; Be brief; Be seated.
10:15 until you choose to leave - Open Networking, follow up with people you are interested in meeting following their elevator pitch, exchange business cards, peruse the library, arrange follow up meetings, etc.
1 - Make sure you come with the 30 second elevator pitch - honed - including your targeted companies, your value proposition, etc.
2 - If you are not already a member of our linked in and Facebook groups please join
3 - Once linked to our groups - link to each other - a strong network is a vital component to a successful job search
4 - If you are a member and new to transition send a brief message to the group (from the email you joined the breakfast club from) thebreakfastclubnj@yahoogroups.com introducing yourself - and what companies you are targeting - we have 2500+ members that will respond with help where they can
results.name: The Breakfast Club NJ

results.description:
Columbia University Buddhist Association

The Columbia University Buddhist Association (CUBA) seeks to provide Columbia students and friends with the opportunity to meet regularly in a supportive group setting to practice meditation, discuss Buddhism, and develop friendships. There is a profound need for all of us to maintain a balance between the mind and the body. We believe we can help all Columbia students and friends in the following ways:

 - Deal with stress and other negative states of mind in a productive manner
 - Learn about our negative states of mind through the lens of Buddhist teachings and practices
 - Foster compassion, loving joy, and equanimity in our daily lives

The Columbia Buddhist Association is a student organization that offers Columbia students and friends the opportunity to learn practical techniques for self improvement. The Sangha practices meditation to better manage their negative states of mind (such as anger, stress, and fear). By doing so, participants enhance their ability to remain focused, relaxed, and clear-minded when confronted with difficult or stressful situations.

Although the Columbia Buddhist Association will utilize Buddhist teachings, we are not a religious group in the sense of wanting individuals to convert to Buddhism. Additionally, we do not have support from a specific Buddhist temple. Instead, we have teachers who come from Japanese, Chinese, Indian, Tibetan, even Western traditions. We hope to support the entire Columbia University community and friends in being more reflective and compassionate in our daily lives; we truly believe that this will foster a more equitable and just society!

By the way, no need for cushions. Just bring yourself!
results.name: Columbia University Buddhist Association

results.description: Many of us are familiar with B-tree indexing, the predominant indexing scheme built into nearly all DBMS platforms for the past 40-years - Including NoSQL platforms such as MongoDB. This Meetup Group is for anyone interested in learning how to take full advantage of a more modern indexing scheme, Fractal Tree indexing. Fractal Tree indexing lies at the heart of TokuMX, a high-performance, open source, fork of MongoDB . Join us to learn how you can use TokuMX to turn MongoDB into a powerful big data platform by improving data ingestion by 20x, compressing your MongoDB database by 90% and extending the life of your storage hardware systems with 2x better write-optimization - All without having to make any changes to your MongoDB applications.
results.name: TokuMX NYC - Super-charging MongoDB in New York

This group is about your relationship with your husband… come see how you can better a good relationship or fix a broken one!

I am a life coach, soccer coach and former restaurant owner! I believe growing up in the restaurant business, playing soccer and coaching for 30 years has been a great foundation for my working with people and their relationships. Life coaching…especially in the areas of relationships has come easy to me. It is very near and dear to my heart. Why? Because I’ve BEEN THERE. And if it weren’t for the people who came out of the woodwork to help me, I wouldn’t be here to help YOU!

I have been married 25 years… have 6 almost grown kids… love my husband more than anything in the world and we were separated for 3 years at one point too!!! Wow! We have lived through interstate moves, many job changes, deaths that were close to us, crazy insane families, depression, grief, anxiety, anger, surgeries, major financial troubles… and with those 6 kids- 4 of them were in college at once! 

So come join me in exploring what marriage is really all about!

Dorina

results.description:
We are an informal group of adult video gamers, who have been playing online video games together, consistently for over 15 years. While we are primarily East Coast, Brooklyn based gamers, our online community contains gamers who we regularly play with across many different States (Utah, Colorado, New Orleans, Massachusetts... etc), across many different platforms and games. We also keep in contact with one another across many different mediums, such as facebook, skype, internet forums, and regular text. As gamers we are all adults, with full-time jobs, some with families, and/or pursing further schooling. As a result, our atmosphere is drama-free, friendly, and mature. Who has time for drama when you have work in the morning? Ages 21+ is our preferred atmosphere. We enjoy online gaming not just as a hobby, but also a means to foster communities and build friendships. Many of us, are not just fellow gamers who share in a hobby, but are also real life friends. Many of those friendships were formed within different online gaming communities across the decade. We hope our meetup group will continue to build these types of positive relationships created by gaming. As a gaming group, we are an eclectic group with different tastes who all consider online gaming a hobby. Many of us are both casual and hardcore online gamers, with roots also stemming in tabletop and collectible card games (MTG, Yu-Gi-Oh, Versus, Pokemon, D&D... etc).

We are currently engaged in Destiny for the Playstation 4 and Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn across multiple platforms and are actively recruiting. While online guilds and clans are a-plenty, our group likes to know who we're playing with. If you're interested in joining our local online gaming community and our other extended online gaming community, we tend to meet-up at different places in Brooklyn and NYC.

In addition, think of our meetup as a way to meet new people who might be playing other online games as well. We hope this is an opportunity to form brand new communities, organic, specifically to meetup. Take the opportunity to meet new people and see what types of games they play. It's a great opportunity to find similar ground in similar games, to build relationships in-game and as well as in real life.

Typically we meet at Xe May Sandwich Shop: 96 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10009. We can be emailed at brooklynlegend718@gmail.com
results.name: Brooklyn Legend - New York Based Online Gaming Community

Designing Change is a monthly meetup examining the intersection of good design, powerful storytelling, and social change. This group is for people who have had a suicide attempt or struggle with suicidal thoughts. 

It can be difficult to talk about suicide without upsetting or scaring your listener. Nevertheless, I believe that sharing one's thoughts and fears is essential for the healing process. Come and meet us if you need to share with or listen and connect to people with similar issues. 

Important!

If you consider yourself at an immediate risk, please call suicide hotline, 911, or a trusted loved one! 

Reach out! Speak up! Help is near!

N.B.

*This group is not a substitute for therapeutic or psychiatric help, neither it is intended to provide any professional health care service.

**This group does not encourage or help in any way the self harm of any person. 

***The group does not tolerate members' action intended to facilitated a third person's suicide. Transgressors will be banned from the group and prosecuted according to the laws applicable.
results.name: NYC suicide support group

results.description:
Subscribe to our email list: http://livingliberally.org/drinking/

Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/drinkingliberallynational

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/DrinkLiberally

We're an informal, inclusive progressive social group. Raise your spirits
while you raise your glass, and share ideas while you share a pitcher.
Drinking Liberally gives like-minded, left-leaning individuals a place
to talk politics. You don't need to be a policy expert and this isn't a
book club - just come and learn from peers, trade jokes, vent
frustration and hang out in an environment where it's not taboo to talk
politics.

Bars are democratic spaces - you talk to strangers, you share booths,
you feel the bond of common ground. Bring democratic discourse to your
local democratic space - build democracy one drink at a time.

While drinking liberally, always remember to drink responsibly, and make
liberal use of designated drivers. Drinking and driving is reckless and
irresponsible, like a neocon war or corporatist tax cut. Liberals, don't
do it.

It began in New York City in May, 2003, when it felt as though the
politicians, press and public were giving conservative cons a free pass.
We began as one-part support group and one-part strategy session,
playing with slogans and ideas we thought Democrats needed to be
saying.

And when we came up with a particularly good slogan, we made
buttons.

Occasionally, we bring in group questions, or talking points to back
up the buttons. Sometimes our group list shares articles and forwards.
But mostly, we keep it non-programmatic and free-flowing and create a
space where people learn about each other's ideas, activities and
enlarge a circle of progressive friends.
results.name: Drinking Liberally NYC

results.description:
We're building a fun, safe environment for dedicated creative writers interested in publishing short fiction, and we are currently seeking new members confident in their ability to work according to the following schedule:

Our group meets weekly from 7-9pm on Wednesdays at Saint's Alp in the East Village. 

We round-robin new short stories weekly, meaning that with six members (our current max), we're each expected to bring a new piece every six weeks. The current writer sends out his story the day after our previous meeting, meaning six days before the week it's read. This gives everyone the time to fit the story into their schedule, including any member who has to send their notes electronically that week. (The story should be in docx format, with 1" margins and a double-spaced, readable, 12p font.)

After receiving feedback, the writer has a week to make revisions and resubmit his story for the meeting two weeks after the story's initial reading. This is means the group reads one new and one old story each week, and that each writer is always in the process of writing a new story and revising an old one. 

NYC Shorts is dedicated to publication, an outcome possible only to writers intent on honing their craft and producing regular, high-quality work. The schedule is (somewhat) tight, but designed to keep members engaged, week after week. I've seen a lot of writing groups fail for a lot of reasons, but never because of too many dedicated writers.

If you've got the passion, skill, and time to meet weekly, read two stories per week, and write and revise one story per month, join now!
results.name: NYC Shorts - Short Story Writers

results.description:
Isha Yoga offers free meditation classes, classical hatha yoga programs, public events, and social gatherings for adults and families to learn yoga and meditation, practice yoga and meditate together and have fun!   In accordance with Meetup guidelines, any children under the age of 18 present at an Isha Yoga Meetup must be supervised by a parent or guardian.  

We look forward to meeting you, soon!

-----------------

What is Isha Yoga? 

Isha Yoga was founded by Isha Foundation, an international nonprofit organization dedicated to raising human consciousness. The Foundation offers powerful tools for inner wellbeing from the ancient science of yoga.  Through classical yoga and meditation, Isha empowers individuals to transform their lives, raising the consciousness of humanity one person at a time. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUeyqLTsGJs

Jump right in!   Meditate Effortlessly on your own right NOW!... 

Try Isha Kriya, FREE Guided Meditation at www.IshaKriya.com 

Isha Kriya Free Guided Meditation:

Many people find meditation difficult and frustrating when they first begin practicing, struggling with the ceaseless activity of the mind and restlessness of the body. Often, people give-up on meditation before they can reap its incredible benefits, including stress reduction, relaxation, inner peace and mental focus. 

The Isha Kriya guided meditation is a simple, but powerful inner process to align your mind, body, and inner-energies to naturally arrive at a meditative state.  Once you are meditative for even a few minutes on a daily basis, your perception of yourself and the world around becomes much deeper and richer. 

Isha Kriya guided meditation can be learned through 1-hour free meditation classes (live, local to you on Meetup), live online meditation webinars (listed weekly on Meetup, FB, Twitter), anytime through our online guided meditation video (at IshaKriya.com), or anytime and anywhere with the Isha Kriya Mobile App, available for free on all Android and Apple mobile devices.  Search for Isha Kriya in your play store to download. Meditate anywhere... then share the bliss with a friend!

12-18 minutes of Isha Kriya meditation practice daily reduces stress, anxiety and depression; increases health, energy and vitality; enhances mental focus and clarity and establishes a sense of peace and deep inner balance. Isha Kriya meditation is a gentle, seated practice. No previous yoga or meditation experience is necessary.  Realized yogi, Sadhguru, explains more about the Isha Kriya free guided meditation in the introductory video below...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K4hCvdDn7Zc

"Meditation is a simple process that gives you a little distance from your own mind and your own body," explains realized yogi, Sadhguru. "You have probably heard of the word 'Buddha.' 'Bu' means 'buddhi,' or the intellect. 'Dha' means 'dada,' or one who is above. One who is 'above his intellect' is a Buddha. A Buddha has clear perception of the nature of his mind...Once you are in your intellect, stress, anxiety and tension are very normal; Once there is a distance from your physical body and your mental structure, that is the end of suffering." 

----------------------- 

Take a Deeper Step and Completely Transform Your Life:  
Eliminate Stress, Improve Relationships, Enhance Mental Clarity and Much, MUCH, more...

Inner Engineering Online Program - 7 Life-transforming Sessions in Your own Space:

"If life were to come with a manual, this in my opinion would be it! If we all applied the Inner Engineering technology, our world would instantly transform to exist from a foundation of peace, joy, and compassion for all beings." ~Evita Ochel, Evolving Beings, Consciousness Expansion and Heart-centered Living. 

What is Inner Engineering about? Inner Engineering is a 7-session online course that provides tools and solutions to empower yourself to create your life the way you want it. The program has been designed by Sadhguru, a yogi, visionary, and one the foremost authorities on yoga. 

Inner Engineering gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods that are the distilled essence of the yogic sciences. The course imparts practical wisdom to manage your body, mind, emotions, and the fundamental life energy within.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ooFAmT4n89Y

 Inner Engineering Benefits - A Family Physician Shares her Experience:  
(See more on the IE Youtube Channel)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ZRs69hpNB0

Today's Experiences:  Live Reviews from Inner Engineering Participants


Who is Sadhguru?...   

“A world full of love, light and laughter; its time has come. Let us make it happen.” - Sadhguru 

Renowned for his powerful programs and humanitarian initiatives, Isha Foundation founder, Sadhguru is a realized yogi, mystic, and visionary who tirelessly works for the wellbeing of all. Sadhguru has been hosted to speak and offer guided meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress. 

Isha Foundation has offered the immense benefits of classical yoga and meditation to over 7 million people over the last 30 years. Isha's US-based meditation and yoga retreat center, Isha Institute of Inner-sciences (iii), is located on 1400 breathtaking acres of Tennessee's spectacular Cumberland Plateau.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1PSNvu3JNc

Isha Institute of Inner-sciences - A Serene Mountain Getaway to Learn Classical Yoga and Meditation 

Relax and Rejuvenate at Isha's Yoga Retreat Center— 

The Isha Institute of Inner-sciences is a breathtaking mountain yoga retreat providing stress relief, rejuvenation and outdoor recreation just 45 minutes outside of Chattanooga, Tennessee. The retreat is a world-class yoga center offering classical yoga and meditation classes from beginner to advanced levels. Guests journey from around the globe to visit this unique destination to relax, reflect, and reconnect within at this tranquil oasis nestled in Tennessee’s spectacular Upper Cumberland!

Drop-by for a Day Visit

The Isha retreat center offers campus tours daily that include light hikes to one of many beautiful bluff vistas or waterfalls and a visit inside the largest yoga and meditation hall in the western hemisphere! Free guided meditation sessions are available each day, offering guests an 18-minute meditation practice called ‘Isha Kriya’ that participants can take home and do on their own. Isha Kriya is a gentle practice for anyone age 12 or older.

Hiking and Mountain Biking on Pristine Forested Trails

The Isha yoga retreat center also offers myriad opportunities for hiking and mountain biking on forested trails winding throughout its nearly 1400 acres. The yoga center's five miles of mountain biking trails have been professionally classified from beginner to intermediate skill levels, with steep climbs, water features, and tight switchbacks on the more challenging portions of the bike trail. The trails are part of an expanding network of over 15 miles of hiking and biking trails featuring beautiful waterfalls, a meandering spring-fed creek, and breathtaking bluff overlooks.

Relaxation & Wellness Retreats

Overnight stays include the option of private studio accommodations, delicious vegetarian buffet meals, and beginner-level yoga classes of the visitor`s choice, such as the 'yoga of sound', yoga for strengthening the joints, and yoga for purifying life energies.  Extended retreat packages feature Ayurvedic rejuvenation consultations and therapies; guided hikes and outdoor adventure outings to nearby caves, rivers and falls; and even vegetarian cooking classes to bring home some of your favorite vegetarian delights!  Learn how to mix the pungent, tangy spices of the East, culture farm-fresh milk into yogurt, roll vegetarian sushi, or bake homemade sourdough bread in the Isha center's popular international, vegetarian kitchen.

For more information on Isha yoga retreats and meditation programs at iii, visit: Visiting Isha Retreat  
For programs nationwide, visit: Isha Yoga Programs

IshaUSA - Blog - http://www.ishaUSA.org/blog

results.description: We're an inclusive social meet-up where politically progressive folks of all stripes and levels of involvement can meet, hang out, drink, discuss, and debate, in a casual happy-hour setting. Drinking Liberally is part of Living Liberally, an organization that seeks to build progressive communities through social networks and events. It started in 2003, during what was a fairly rough time to be politically liberal, as a group that was one-part support group and one-part strategy session, playing with slogans and ideas we thought the political left needed to be saying. And when we came up with a particularly good slogan, we made buttons. Occasionally, we bring in group questions, or talking points to back up the buttons. Sometimes our group list shares articles and forwards. But mostly, we keep it non-programmatic and free-flowing and create a space where people learn about each other's ideas, activities and enlarge a circle of progressive friends. We meet at 4th Ave Pub in Park Slope every first Tuesday, with the occasional other event as they come up. Come join us!
results.name: Drinking Liberally Downtown Brooklyn

This is a free social network  for single, divorced, widowed, men&women  over the age of 29,  in any area of NYC, Nassau  and beyond, in order to meet in a friendly, light and easy environment, which is conducive to talking and getting to know each other.  We will meet in cafes and other gatherings that are friendly and relaxed environments. In other words, environments that can foster friendships. The majority of the gatherings will be in Queens, but I will be open to some suggestions in neighboring Nassau county. I will also form workshops that are specifically designed to help those who are struggling with dating. These valuable workshops will foster self-confidence, guidance, self-awareness, and valuable peer feedback. All of this will serve as navigational tools on our journey for love.  My new book, Lessons from the Needle in a Haystack, will be our guide in these workshops and all-day seminars. As a courtesy to the group, the cost for the workshops are kept low so everyone has a chance to join, and of course are optional, as are all the gatherings. I also am organizing dances, as well as single barbecues and big single-mingles so people have a chance to meet each other. As the membership grows I will be facilitating weekend retreats. Please join us, you never know if your soul mate is part of this group ! 

Additionally, if you RSVP for a paid event and back out within 3 days, or less of the event date,  you will be subject to a $10 organizer "no show" fee, because I have already prepaid for that event and it will cover your place in the event that I paid for you. 

<br>

results.description:
This is a workshop/networking group for anyone interested in having a better business. Developing a support group of piers that will NOT try to sell you something. This group is a workshop for business and startups that facilitates members to pitch each other and improve go to market strategies.

BECAUSE In Today’s business environment, it seems that, regardless of industry or size of the organization.... are always answering the same questions…
How do we increase sales?
how do we grow our business?
how do I meet my forecast?
How can I generate leads?

Our own hypothesis required that we find a pinnacle point to address these symptoms. In short, after working with thousands of customers over a 20 year period and traveling globally, our research shows that one common denominator addresses: why your products, services or even ideas are not performing in the market place.

We use Customer Acceptance as the gauge of market performance. Although aligning our discussions to the top line, we understand that there are plenty of opportunities to bolster profits with cost analysis and re-adjustment. Our Customer Acceptance Methodology gives us the ability to test your business model, problem statement, value propositions, customer segmentation, market opportunity and much more importantly Market Product Fit. The summary of this data will determine how and if you should proceed with your business model. we tie it all together with a move forward strategy simply stating how to Get, Keep and Grow Customers .
results.name: New York Startup Businesses Customer Development Workshop

results.description:
Maybe you're on the cusp of a big change in your life that you want to make the most of (a new job, the end or beginning of a relationship, a big move, becoming a parent), or perhaps you're poised to take a big risk (maybe start that business you've always wanted, publish a novel, write a screenplay, take a trip or move abroad, etc.).  

Or maybe you don't know exactly what you want, you just know you're not where you want to be and you're ready for everything to change.  

If any of this resonates with you, this group is the right place for you. 

This group is for those of us who do not want to watch our unlived life go by -- the one we know in our hearts we were meant to live -- and who are ready to start taking some big steps to find and follow our heart's calling.  It does not matter what your background is, how old you are, what your profession is, or what stage of the journey you are at -- commitment to the journey itself is the only requirement here.  

Of course, succeeding in pursuing your heart's goals is not just about reaching a fork in the road and choosing the path less traveled -- it's also about STAYING on that unbeaten path without running back to the old, "safe" path at the first sign of difficulty (a temptation that can be very hard to resist).  

The best way to do this -- indeed, perhaps the ONLY way to successfully do this -- is with the support of like-minded people, which is exactly what this group is about. 

We hope you will join us for a series of free interactive workshops designed to support those of us who want to live an unbounded life full of unlimited possibilities -- a life where our heart's desires are not only possible, but, inevitable.  

The workshops will focus on such topics as risk-taking, recognizing and breaking through limiting beliefs, learning how to tap into and make the most of synchronicity, and the art of manifestation, among other topics.  We also want to hear from members as to what topics they'd like to have the free workshops cover.  

The end-goal here is to share, learn from each other, support each other, bounce ideas off each other without judgment, and create a community that promotes and celebrates risk-taking for your heart's goals (which, unfortunately, our families, friends and society are not always on board with).  

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: The Unbounded Life:  Pursuing Your Heart's Goals

results.description:
IMPORTANT:  Due to the new season change, we are going to post all remaining 2015-2016 screening events to the following - http://www.meetup.com/NY-Exclusive-Academy-...   Please go to that address to apply.  See you there!  This site will close down on 11/1/2015 noon.  Thank you!

Every year during the Awards season, if you are a voter for Oscars, SAG Award, WGA/PGA/DGA/BAFTA Award, etc, you probably would be bombarded with free screening invites. (Many of them even include Q&A with stars/director/writers. Such screenings will be featured on this site) And I can't be the only one who thought it would be fun to go there with multiple people, getting together after the movie and talk about what we just saw. (And maybe, you might meet someone new...) If that's what you have in mind, this meetup is for you.

Wouldn't it be nice to be able to see movies possibly with the likes of Daniel Day-Lewis, Sally Field, Matt Damon, Matthew McConaughey, Jessica Chastain, Steven Spielberg, Bill Murray, George Clooney, Kiera Knightly, Scarlett Johansson, Anne Hathaway, Robert DeNiro, Hillary Swank, Felicity Jones, etc and ask them questions directly in person afterwards? For all this for free? Or see all these Oscar contender films before everyone else has a chance to see them at all at some gorgeous and cushy private screening rooms (with no worries for bedbugs)? This is a privilege we have as voters (who are truly in this show business and really work there, not as a spectator) and that's the experience we will be able to share once you join this group, ultimately will lead us into our exclusive Oscars Viewing Party.

(I wish I could make the site more visible for non-members so that people can actually see what kind of movies we are offering. Unfortunately, the team of studio attorneys warned us that we are being watched - for understandable reason since we deal with many yet-to-be-released films and Q&A events with high profile celebrities - so I'll have to make it private until you join us once the award season gets underway. Sorry about that.)

Voters are entitled to one guest (note: guests do NOT need to be guild members) so the numbers can grow pretty quickly. However, in terms of joining this group, we need to limit to people in the 20s - 50s who are members of any of the following (required to be able to actually sign up for the screenings for free - Studios do check the membership card so please be honest. Otherwise, we wouldn't be able to help you): AMPAS, HFPA, BAFTA, SAG-AFTRA, DGA, PGA, WGA and others. (If you do not know the meaning of ANY of these abbreviations, then most likely, you cannot join this group. Sorry... UNLESS you have a referral from an existing member or you have a close friend who is a voting member who can help you get in)
results.name: NY Exclusive Academy/Guild Voter Screening Meetup

topics.name: Learn how to Use Your Digital Camera

results.description:
Want to take better pictures but not sure how to improve? Want to start looking through your viewfinder in a different way? I can help!

I've been a photographer for close to 3 decades and have both exhibited and sold my work. I'm also a visual person for my day job, so I can teach you some very basic technical principals, though I'll mostly talk about the composition of your frame. I'm mostly intuitive as opposed to overly technical, however, I'm very creative and perhaps I can help you "see" through your viewfinder in a different way. I'm very patient and non-judgmental - all that matters to me is that you want to have fun while improving the visual quality of your work.

It would be better if you had a real camera (a point and shoot is fine) as opposed to a cell phone or ipad, but if that's all you have then I might be able to give you at least a couple of pointers. This won't be a super technical meetup, but I can get you on your way to having a nicely composed and well-lighted shot.

Between meetups be sure to check the group message board on occasion, as I will be posting sites that can give you quick and easy tips to help you along in your photographic journey.

Also - when going to one of our meetups please keep in mind that if you RSVP "Yes" to an event but then cannot make it and do not change your RSVP to "No" or send me a message you cannot attend (for two separate meetups), that you will be expelled from the group. No exceptions. 

So, join me - I'm an Astoria, Queens resident and many meetups will take place in the Astoria/LIC area. Let's get to snappin' some pics and havin' some fun!
results.name: Beginners Photography Creative Tips - Astoria/LIC

results.description:
“We are here to awaken from the illusion of our separateness.”
-Thich Nhat Hanh

What is The Big Lotus?
In the NYC area, there are lots of active Buddhist groups and practice centers. So what’s the deal with yet another Buddhist Meetup? Simply put, The Big Lotus focuses on building connections. We aim to provide an open, casual environment for anyone interested in and/or new to Buddhism. We especially aim to build friendships and to help the dharmically inclined navigate the Buddhist path.

For the first time in (Buddhist) history, many traditions have the chance to encounter and interact with each other. The Big Lotus aspires to support the NYC Buddhist community by cultivating connections between groups and individuals from all traditions.

Why are we called “The Big Lotus”?
In Buddhism, the lotus symbolizes perseverance and purity. The lotus of the Buddha’s teachings now grows in New York, also known as The Big Apple.
results.name: The Big Lotus

results.description:
This group is by and for<br> that word-hungry species<br> called the New York Poet<br> which gathers in the name of company, tea and creation

You may find them<br> in the hushed corner of a New York City café<br> pens in pause and eyebrows<br> intent on verbal brilliance

Perhaps grinning with the satisfaction<br> of genius-ly rouge punctuation

or laughing over the ambiguities<br> which comprise that most potent human tool<br> that is language

The written word-<br> smitten in workshops<br> and shared among friends<br> who celebrate not the latest iPhone craze<br> but the timeless temptation of stanza This group is for the alchemist<br> who dares to test the beauty<br> of couplets scribbled on napkins Take a coffee and bring your long-time poetic heroes<br> your inspiration purged into leather-bound journals<br> and join us

This group is for the curious and experienced<br> bold and modest<br> rhyme and free verse<br> alliteration lover<br> Dickinson, Shakespeare and Hemmingway of our day

This group is for the New York Poet.


WHEN
We will hold meetings approximately twice a month, most likely in Brooklyn or Manhattan. COST
Events are pay-as-you-wish, to help cover the costs of the group. Your contribution keeps the group open.

ATTENDANCE
1) If you RSVP yes, you are expected to be there (and we want you to be!) ***Anyone who RSVP's to an event and is a no show on three separate occasions will be removed from the group :(
If you RSVP Yes, then cannot come, please provide your reason with 24 hours notice, if possible. Those who RSVP then do not show up and do not write, will be marked as a no show and removed from the group after three no-shows.
2) Please be timely. We will typically meet at said location 15 minutes prior to settle in and order our refreshments, then begin writing.
3) Poets who join the group but are inactive for 5 months (that is no RSVP either "yes" or "no" and does not communicate or contribute to the group in any way) will be removed.

RESPECT
Poetry is an art, and everyone will have a different interpretation of what that means. There is no "right" or "wrong" poem, and the poetic creations of all -and their creators- are to be treated with respect.
results.name: Tea & Poetry

results.description:
This is a different kind of single parent support group. Single Parents Sharing Resources is a cooperative that will enable single parents to built networks to create a practical support system in Rockland/Bergen Counties and Western Westchester, to empower families socially, spiritually, and economically.

Single parents can be isolated and overworked. This group will enable members to team up with other local single parents to share childcare, share resources, and share rent/mortgages (homesharing). Meetups will enable parents to meet and connect with other like-minded single parents looking to create practical support systems. 

Even finding one other parent to team up with to share meals with on a weekly basis can be a boon, reducing the workload and creating social connections and support (for example: dinner at your house Tuesdays, dinner at my house Wednesdays). In the past, meeting other local parent(s) whose schedule matched yours was difficult, but modern technology enables these connections.

Examples of support systems we're creating include but are not limited to:

 -Childcare cooperatives: can be as simple as getting together with one other parent to take turns doing childcare. Can be as elaborate as large groups that keep track of child-care credits or home-school cooperatives. 

-Resource sharing--clothing swaps, costume swaps, sharing items like lawn mowers, cooking tools, canning tools, et al.

 -Home-sharing--connect with other parents looking to team up to provide daily practical support to each other and split the costs of home rentals or mortgages through home-sharing. 

-Meal sharing--taking turns with other parents to cook and host meals. Great to not have to cook dinner every night, and creates social support system as well. 

-Work parties: need to clean out the garage, move, make dinner, bake bread, build a play structure, build a chicken coop, etc, etc, etc? Host a work party, have fun, and get helping hands on the job.

Join us and explore the exciting possibilities for THRIVING when single parents team up!
results.name: Single Parents Sharing Resources, Hudson Gateway

results.description:
"Modern life seems to condemn us to live in an awe-depleted, efficiency driven world, where reductionism runs rampant and big questions about life are all but eradicated".  (The New Existentialist)


Hello and welcome to Perennial Philosophies.

This is a reading and discussion group. Ideally, we will read an assignment (essay, article, novel, treatise, poem/song, letters, et cetera), or watch some footage, and then gather to share our respective engagement with the assignment. A discussion will ensue of which I shall moderate and facilitate (~2 hours). I welcome your conscientiousness.

Membership is open to people with or without a background in philosophy. Nonetheless, an earnest fidelity to the discussion is mandatory.

In addition, an interdisciplinary/integral attitude to the material(s) and idea(s) is encouraged, yet any ideological perspective , or lifestyle/method is welcomed.

Western and Eastern material will be explored; from the Axial Age to late-modernity, from Reason to Revelation, from magic to quantum physics.

Our daily lives are full of things/experiences that keep us busy, preoccupied and dormant. Yet every now and again, we find ourselves drawing-back, reflecting, and wondering; what is it all about?

Perhaps a new consciousness might momentarily emerge; a ripple of truth appear ......

So, let's gather, discuss, pause, reflect and then leave each meet-up/conversation with a perspective wider, deeper, and richer than the one we had when entering it.   A perennial awakening?
results.name: Perennial Philosophies : a reading & conversation group

results.description: If your life seems flat, your body feels creaky and your soul is yearning for something better out there, come join us at our beautiful traditional dojo to learn the unique self-defense art of aikido. results.description:
This is Warhammer 40k fight club. We are a bunch of brilliant, wealthy, and strikingly handsome 30 and 40 something wargamers, voraciously engrossed in the thick of this immersive, hobby-tabletop, wargame called: Warhammer 40k.



We are a highly active club that congress frequently. At which time, we proceed to pound each others faces in, on one of our four fancy lil' snow globes, you would recognize as "war gaming tabletops".



Besides our penchant for pain, a good portion of our time is reserved for the ancillary aspects of the game. At our clubhouse, "DaBunka!", we paint, craft, design, custom terrain and our miniatures (man-barbies), talk shop about the game, plan trips to conventions, brush up on rules, and plot each others demise....


Our club also organizes the vast spectrum 40k tournament formats in the Greater New York area, monthly. Stay tuned for upcoming events in your "Discussions" section.



If you're a 40k gaming junkie like the rest of our merry, bog-eyed bunch, then make an effort to say "hello". You can find out more information on us in our forums section, here on MeetUp.



What are you waiting for? The bells of destiny toll your deathknell...We'll stock a warm coffin with your name on it.
results.name: Queens Fight Club: 40k

results.description:
About NYC Digital Photography Club...


For insurance purposes, we are no longer accepting registrations for workshops and walks through THIS Meetup group. To register for our workshops and walks, please visit our sister group NYC Digital Photography Workshops official website athttp://www.meetup.com/NYCDPW/.


We list workshops on this Meetup website to let you know what’s available, but you must register for our offerings as listed above.


New to photography? Know your way around a camera but your skills need some fine tuning?


With so many resources now available out there, where do you start? New York City, itself, hosts over 100 groups on photography instruction, but do they have near a century of photography experience to back that up? And more importantly, the drive to share that knowledge with you? Do they have a long list of positive references from other students?


Our experts in the field can help guide you through the process – both creative and technical – in image making.



NYC Digital Photography Workshops creates fun, yet informative, SEMI-PRIVATE and PRIVATE workshops that spark creativity and technical know-how with or without having the latest and greatest gear. We offer semi-private and private workshops on over 120 photography topics on everything from how to use your new DSLR, manual settings and composition to studio lighting, fashion and street photography. You will learn real-world photography techniques both in the studio and/or in the field.

NYCDPW leads themed Monthly Photo Walking Tours with its owner, Dawn M. Wayand, to exercise your skills, build your portfolio and make new friends in a more intimate group environment as well as Monthly Semi-Private “Learn and Shoot” Photo Walks with Instructor Ron Jautz where a topic for questions is set by the walk location. We provide outlets for your photography via occasional Group Exhibitions in various places such as SoHo, Chelsea, Lower East Side and more.

We aim to build your confidence as a photographer all while giving you the skills you need to succeed as a photographer. At NYCDPW, you will be part of a community of photographers, from novice to expert, where you can hone your craft. Our instructors, themselves working photographers, have walked in your shoes. They speak your language and understand your challenges. Yes, intuitive instruction that doesn’t cost an arm and a leg.


Register today…we look forward to helping YOU become the photographer YOU want to be!


Shoot. Learn. Become MORE Awesome.




Already a member of NYC Digital Photography Workshops?

Please DO NOT sign up for THIS group as we offer the exact same classes and you will only receive duplicate emails and reminders for classes. Stick with NYC Digital Photography Workshops as you can no longer register for workshops on THIS Meetup website.


Not a member of NYC Digital Photography Workshops and interested in a wider variety of photography classes?


Please sign up for our SISTER group, NYC Digital Photography Workshops at http://www.meetup.com/NYCDPW/.
results.name: Camera Voyages

I turned my disabilities into abilities. This group is open to anyone with misophonia and/or any type of sensory defensiveness, and to anyone living with someone with misophonia and/or sensory defensiveness. A 1-2 hour visual demonstration of real time currency trading. Hosted by futures trading instructors from The Foreign Exchange Trading Academy. The first hour will concentrate mostly on the topic being discussed and short term visual trading will be easily seen on a large screen monitor. Examples and resources will be given to aid everyone on each topic that is discussed. The last hour will be a Q&;A where the group can ask anything forex,futures, option or any other trading related subject. This is a great opportunity to hear about the largest market which is open 24 hours a day and 5 days a week. Instructors bring different experiences, stories, and strategies to the table and are made up of licensed futures reps as well as financial advisers . Groups are held in a large boardroom at 48 Wall Street in the 11th floor, as well as other convenient locations including 23rd street and 6th ave as well as 3000 ocean parkway in brooklyn. This is an excellent opportunity to stop by, and check out the world of forex and futures trading. From beginner traders to the most sophisticated we try and cater the discussion to the group so no stone is left unturned. 

Those also looking for funding for trading accounts and free 25 minute live demos can be found on our website www.teachingcurrencytrading.com or email us at Contactus@teachingcurrencytrading.com

results.description:
The SMART Recovery Social & Reading Group (SR^2) is a closed, peer-led group for participants, facilitators, and friends of SMART Recovery who are familiar with the basics of SMART Recovery. The goals of this group are to delve into the tools and 4 Points of SMART Recovery more deeply and also to socialize outside of SMART meetings.

During reading meetups, we will focus on the study and application of the tools of SMART Recovery in detail, as well as read and apply other books, essays, and articles which can be directly related to the 4 Points of SMART Recovery, focus on lasting behavioral change, and which are science-based.  During social meetings, we'll do fun stuff. Hopefully, most meetings will contain a little learning and a little fun!

This is not a facilitated SMART Recovery meeting (for those, visit SMART NYC's page), but instead a reading and social group where any member can lead a social outing or a discussion around readings and topics related to the 4 Points of SMART. That means that you can organize and announce a meetup anytime you want. Want to drill ABCs? Schedule a meetup! Want to play ping pong with other SMARTies? Schedule a meetup! This group is what you make it to be!
results.name: SMART Recovery NYC Social & Reading Group

results.description:
This group is for anyone who wants to control their brain at the highest levels. Brain Body Mastery has two main components. One is mindfulness and other types of meditation, or low stimulus attention control, meaning focusing in a slow and quiet way. The other component is high stimulus attention control, which is about taking simple movements and brain exercises, and integrating them into complex, whole brain activities. They are usually done at faster speed and can demand a fair amount of physical and mental effort.

The following videos explain what this group is about better than any of what's written here, but scroll down if you'd like to read more of what's behind all this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9a8Mz5lWzjg

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_uPWHXFEwy4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aNsNIqRVeDc&index=20&list=UUQThuzMvIkqC8wcVjTMjQFg 

Sign up for the FREE self-paced online course here: www.effortwise.info

The beauty of BrBd is that anyone can create new exercises. All it takes is curiosity and a little effort. Find two or more simple, separate activities and integrate them into one, and you grow your brain. Practice mindfulness or meditation, and you grow your brain. Even just practice being curious once in a while, and usually your brain grows.

The goal of BrBd is to be as in control of our conscious energy as possible. The implications reach far beyond just performing better at work or school. The more control you have over how your mind functions, the more quickly you can learn new skills, the more creative you can be, the more relaxed and present you can be, meaning you make better decisions. Aside from the longer term benefits, practicing just makes ya feel good.

For more on the subject of skill learning, here is a page from my website on how to master anything.
results.name: Brain Body Mastery

results.description:
My Story: I grew up in Pennsylvania 2 hours outside of Philly near Lebanon. Needless to say I have been a diehard Eagles fan for as long as I remember. Shortly after collage life’s journey lead me to Seattle WA where I started an Eagles Meet-up. On average we drew 50-60 Eagle fans every Sunday. I moved to Connecticut 3 months ago & hope to start a similar group in the Stamford, Norwalk, Fairfield & Westchester County area. There’s nothing like watching Eagles football surrounded by fans who “get it”! 

The Plan: By far the biggest challenge in starting a group like this is finding a suitable location. Fortunately Castle Bar & Grill (on Summer St) has agreed to give us access to their private room. 
The following are benefits Eagle fans can expect during every game. 

• Sound: No more listening to the Giants/Jets in a crowded bar! 

• Drink specials 

• Food specials 

• A community of diehard Eagle fans!

Important Note 

In order to secure the room we NEED a minimum of 10 people to attend each week. This is simply to make it cost effective for Castle to keep the room open for us. We’ll use the first few weeks as a test to gauge interest level & attendance. Please RSVP so we can get an accurate head count.
results.name: Philadelphia Eagles Fans of Stamford CT

My point is, if their software or education program was so good, they would be making a lot of money and not selling it.

topics.name: Ending the Isolation of Chronic Illness

results.description:
There are no scoliosis meetups or support groups in the NYC area to my knowledge. I have moderate scoliosis, and I decided to start one. If alcoholics have AA and drug addicts have NA, and there are support groups for a slew of other types of mental health and health issues, it's about time scoliosis got a support group of its own. We suffer too, don't we? Doesn't our condition impact our lives in significant ways, mentally and physically?

The only place where I read about the spiritual-psychological aspect of scoliosis was in a text written by Katharina Schroth, who founded the Schroth Method of scoliosis treatment in the early 20th Century (http://www.scoliosisjournal.com/content/6/1/17):

"Curvature of the spine, or scoliosis, is a precarious formal defect in terms of health, appearance, and the spiritual-psychological aspect. When attempting to help a scoliotic with this defect, we must not view the matter primarily from the mechanical standpoint, namely the malfunctioning body. For we have before us not a mechanical structure of bony levers and the muscles that move them, but rather an unfortunate person who has lost the form originally created for her and who cannot restore it by herself. With all scoliotic people, the cause probably lies partly in the mental realm. Envision what the expression "not in good form" means. Imagine the mental state of a child scolded by his mother. The psychic depression and loss of equilibrium are immediately visible in his abnormal bodily form. How wonderful the form of a little child's body is! What a victorious, natural, matter-of-fact nature he has in the representation of his Self, and in every movement and in all of his life statements.

However, let us observe a school class three or four years later. What has happened to these children? Almost all are missing their original sense of complete, untroubled comfort within. Many children have pronounced signs of suffering in their faces, and their depressed mental state finds expression in their bodies.

Why do gymnastic attempts to erect such a troubled child often fail completely? It is because they approach the child much too mechanically, much too much in the form of exercises, without first becoming familiar with his life difficulties, his unfulfilled needs, which to the adult may seem trivial. Straightening of the external person will only succeed when we can erect the inner person, open an avenue of hope, and allow him to breathe a sigh of relief." (Lehnert-Schroth, Christa, P.T. Three-Dimensional Treatment for Scoliosis, page 5)

Also, I must credit this video for inspiring me to move forward with this group: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yGLzpt3caHw

Physical therapists can't help us deal with the mental issues that are getting in the way of our exercises, which in many cases renders the exercises useless. I believe a support group made up of other people with scoliosis is a crucial way of trying to address the psycho-spiritual contributors of this condition.
results.name: Scoliosis Support Group

results.description:
The NY Sharing Economy Meetup connects the different groups and people in New York City interested in the sharing economy. It is intended for tech and non-tech alike, public and private, academics, founders, students, investors, city officials, visitors to NYC and more. We post sharing economy happenings across New York. 

The Sharing Economy often involves a shift towards interactions between peers and a more sustainable use of resources. It creates a new economic paradigm built on distributed networks of connected individuals and communities rather than on centralized institutions. (You may have heard people refer to it as collaborative consumption, the peer economy and the collaborative economy.) This new economic model is changing our daily lives, our communities, what it means to have a “job,” our cities, and the planet. 

The NY Sharing Economy Meetup is a collaborative organization driven by its members. All members are invited to suggest events that will enable the community to better understand the potential and challenges of this new economy, leverage new technologies, benefit from new opportunities, hear about cutting-edge research, experience new ways of sharing and much more. Examples of groups involved include Let's Collaborate!, New York University, OuiShare, Peers and more.

Note: events that are organized by external parties will be notified as 'PARTNER events'
results.name: NY Sharing Economy Meetup

results.description:
I started this group because I understand how important it is for us to know how to defend ourselves. Unfortunately, the world we live in is not as safe as it used to be, so it is important for us to be prepared in case something unfortunate happens. 

This group is for anyone who is interested in learning real-life self defense. We will learn the self defense system taught in Taekwondo, along with Krav Maga, military combatives, and any other style that you may have trained in. All skill levels are welcome to join, we will all learn from each other in a fun and friendly environment. For those with little to no experience, we will start with the basics and increase complexity was we move along. For those with experience, be ready to get a good workout while furthering your arsenal of skills. We will meet on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 7:30pm to 8:30pm. 

The head instructor will be Vinicius Raposa, who has over a decade of experience in various martial arts. Sir Raposa is an Internationally ranked Black Belt in Taekwondo, with unique self-defense experience developed from his time training with the Brazilian Marines at the Escola Naval, Rio de Janeiro and being the highest ranked Kombato practitioner in the United States. You will be in good hands.

-Dates: Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday

-Times: 7:30pm - 8:30pm

-Location: Newark, NJ

-First meeting is FREE

862-305-0369 (call/text)

results.description:
The Westchester Music of India Group is a volunteer chorus of men and women who are passionate about singing. Our objective is to present public concerts of Songs from India - different regions and languages, in a chorus style, sprinkled with solos. We generally stay away from Bollywood songs. In concerts, we employ live orchestra for accompaniment. Our orchestra is a collection of Indian and Western instruments. While our music is authentically Indian, our performance is a bit fusion in style. Our presentation style is formal and professional, sort of like that of the New York Philharmonic in Lincoln Center.

Our recent concert on October 4, 2015, consisted of 12 non-Bollywood songs from different regions of India. It was a spectacular success and received 10+ minutes spontaneous standing ovation.

We are always looking for new singers to join us. If you would like to sing with us or play ANY Indian instrument reasonably well, please contact us. We are located in Hastings on Hudson, NY.

We do expect long term commitment for rehearsals and performance. There is a simple audition process before acceptance into the chorus.

Feel free to visit our blog: http://moiwestchester.blogspot.com/
results.name: Westchester Music of India Group

results.description:
My name is Camille, and I am the best selling author of "How to Lose Water Weight", "Bye Bye Thunder Thighs", and "The Thigh Gap Hack". I love all things fitness related and this group is a manifestation of one of my all time favorite interests - experimenting with new exercises and workouts! (Please click on any of the links to check out my books)


ABOUT THIS GROUP

Your social calendar just got a lot more interesting! When you join Free Fitness and Beauty Events - NYC meet up group, you'll get first wind of the latest beauty and fitness related parties, socials, in store events, launches, classes / workshops all happening in this great city of ours for absolutely zero dollars (and from time to time very steep discounts)!


 Sure you could comb the web for *some of these events and attend all by your lonesome, but going to these workout classes and beauty events stag, while common, kind of sucks. How can you enjoy your free cocktails, hors d'oeuvres and tunes or share your sense of accomplishment at completing a butt kicking working, if you don't know anyone else at the event because your friends are stuck at work / are too lame to go out / hate anything that doesn't involve drinking / or you're new in town?

Having been to many of these fitness and beauty events I see participants who share so much in common barely connecting with each other because the social aspect isn't fostered or organized - (not that they're to blame.. it's enough work throwing together and hosting these things!)


That's where being a member of this meet up comes in handy! 

Because now you'll have a group of people who share your passion for all things beauty / fashion / fitness attending the events and your great meet up host to facilitate the introductions and conversations. You'll also get to discover and experience dance/fitness classes and be exposed to new beauty brands that you may become a lifelong fan of!


PLEASE NOTE: 

While we plan to organize many of our own exclusive events for members (the more members the more pull we have - so invite your friends!), we will also be sharing events that are open to the public and require RSVP's to get in. 

I hope you'll see how awesome our group is and the immense value we have to offer.
results.name: Free Fitness & Beauty Events

results.description:
Career design is about building a bridge between where you are today and where you want to be. It's about creating work that distinguishes you from the crowd, and lets you to ladder up to the kind of job you want—at a company that affords its employees autonomy and ownership over their work. These companies are known as responsive organizations.

Responsive Career Design helps motivated people build the skills they need to operate and thrive when given the freedom to control their own work. Responsive orgs move faster, make more money, keep employees happier, and attract the best talent. There are more of these companies every year—Starbucks, WL Gore, Spotify, Valve, Tesla—but they're not going to train you to be an innovator.

RCD is a crash course in how people at the fastest, most innovative companies think about problems, plan their careers, and make themselves into assets. How do you become a self-directed worker? What skills let you execute projects effectively across non-technical disciplines? 

The source material for this Meetup is drawn from thought leader interviews and research on areas that impact career advancement most acutely: things like communication, self-instruction, storytelling, and on-the-spot thinking. The contents of this meetup are also available through our email newsletter.

We are a branch of TheResponsiveOrg, an open + non-profit community underwritten by companies like Microsoft and IBM.

Email me if you have questions! --Chris (organizer) cdannen@gmail.com
results.name: Responsive Org Career Design

results.description:
Calling everyone interested in standing up against hate, strengthening ties of communication and cooperation between Muslims and Jews in New York City! 

The New York City Muslim Jewish Solidarity Committee (NYMJSC) was originally initiated by the Foundation for Ethnic Understanding. The committee is a grassroots group of Muslim and Jewish activists, leaders and community members committed to working together. 

The NYC Muslim-Jewish Solidarity Committee is locally organized and has three focus areas:

- Standing Up for Each Other: Muslims and Jews taking joint public stands against hate crimes, incitement or discrimination directed at either community
- Learning About Each Other: Counteract Islamophobia and anti-Semitism within our respective communities
- Organizing and Publicizing: cultural, festive and social service events in order to deepen communal ties and allow individual Jews and Muslims to connect on a personal level

The committee will meet monthly to plan for different types of events and more frequently when crises between the two communities in NYC arise.

results.description:
Firstly, if you are a writer and would like to have pages read, please contact me so I can book you – my ballpark is 4 writers per meetup - there are limited spaces as this is my personal home.

The evening will go something like this:

Approximately four writers will bring 10 or so pages of original writing, generally feature or short scripts. Please bring enough hard copies of your material for each part you need to cast – and don’t forget to cast the narrator – this is often the most important part! Please highlight the lines for each given character- it will make it much easier for the actors.

During the first 15 minutes or so the writers will cast the parts to any actors (or non-shy writers) who are attending. Writers, feel free to give the actors any general notes, caveats, special pronunciations, contexts, etc, but try not to go full Kubrick, as this is a cold reading!

Then we’ll do the reading (the fun, without-a-net part) and then we’ll give a few minutes of feedback. Important: the level of feedback will be directed by the writer. In other words, the writer is invited to ask for general feedback (“Hey, what do you think?”), specific feedback (‘Do we believe Julie when she tells Sam that she wants to keep the baby, regardless of the consequences???”), or no feedback at all (which is perfectly acceptable – just hearing it in the room and seeing if people are laughing and crying in the right places is often enough.)

Bathroom/refreshment break halfway through, then we’ll rock it out till ten or so.

I’ll have some provisions on hand, but please feel free to bring a bottle of wine/pellegrino/pringles/artisanal cheese/your grandmother’s fresh baked cookies, etc…
results.name: Union Square Writer/Actor Group

results.description:
Programming 101: Pen and Paper Coding is an introductory programming class taught using pen and paper only in NYC. 

Our method helps prevent any distractions that occur when using a computer too early on in the learning process, while students focus on getting a solid grasp of the fundamentals of computer programming. 

The goals of the course are ambitious, and the curriculum covers a lot of the materials taught in a typical “Programming 101” course at computer science departments around the world.  

The course consists of 5 sessions, meeting once a week for five consecutive weeks. Group size is between 4-8 students + an experienced instructor. The course fee is $399, and includes all 5 sessions, video recordings of each class, as well as a textbook written by the main instructor specifically for this course. The course is held at Impact Hub (394 Broadway @ Walker St) (nyc.impacthub.net).

Join this Meetup group to stay informed about our courses and visit www.penpapercoding.com for more information!

Come, join us for a dynamic programming class that delivers!

The Pen and Paper Coding Team

results.description:
China-US International Trade Networking is a bridge to bring Chinese manufacturers and US business owners together, a platform to share relevant experience & knowledge, make friends and meet potential business partners!

Background:

International trade has flourished over the years because of the many benefits it has offered to different countries across the globe. China, as the world’s biggest exporter, and the United States, as the world’s biggest importer, are two major trade players. However, due to language and geographical issues, there still has been a gap between U.S. and China’s businessmen/businesswomen in terms of information symmetry and efficiency of resource integration.

We understand that the businessmen/businesswomen in the U.S. are eager to find accessible sources of high quality products with lower cost, and at the same time, a number of giant manufacturers in China are looking for opportunities to expand their global sales networks and sell their products in a more cost-efficient way.

Our Mission:

We believe that the trade between both sides could be organized in a more ACCESSIBLE and EFFICIENT way, and therefore we set up this meet up to help you find your best business partners from China.

Industries Included:

HOLIDAY SUPPLIES/COSTUMES, GIFTS, TOYS, APPAREL, SHOES, EYEWEAR FRAMES, GARDEN EQUIPMENTS, STEEL, etc.

We are open to people/companies from other industries too!

Our Advantage:

- RESOURCE INTEGRATION (With our strong connection with competitive Chinese manufacturers, we could help you quickly identify and match your best-fit business partners from China!)

- NETWORK EXPANSION (Meet up with people have different background but share the same interest!)

- TECHNICAL EXPERTISE (We have a group of experts with a diverse background!)

If you wish to empower your future business backed by reliable manufacturers from China, do not hesitate to take the chance, and JOIN US right now!
results.name: China & US International Trade Networking

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bHjjkXZn0x0

Psychology Dinners is another social innovation experiment created by Glen Brauer inspired from the ongoing success of Philosophy Dinners (PhilosophyDinners.org). Click here to view some feedback from previous Philosophy Dinners events held in cities around the world.

This group is for people who value fun and engaging discussions with intelligent, open-minded and friendly people. This Meetup group was created as part of a non-profit global initiative using practical psychology to bring together strangers and build community.


When will the first event take place?

This depends on how long it takes for members to join this Meetup group.  Typically a Meetup group requires at least 30 members in order to get a turnout of at least 6 people.


What will be the topic for the first event?

I will be sending out a poll to decide that once enough members join this group.


The format for these events will be very similar to Philosophy Dinners:

- open-minded individuals who are as intelligent as they are friendly

- 1 thought-provoking topic provided in advance so you have time to ponder it

- Food for Thought videos provided in advance of event 

- events are held in a charming restaurant

- restaurant is close to public transportation

- 6 people at each table (so everyone has a chance to speak)

- 1 discussion facilitator at each table (members take turns being facilitators)

- thought-provoking questions (discussion notes) are provided by Glen Brauer to the facilitators in order to stimulate the discussions.


There are no membership fees but a small fee is required when signing up for events which goes towards Meetup costs, the time required to research and produce the discussions notes, booking restaurant reservations, scheduling the events, and coordinating the facilitators.

If this sounds interesting to you then click "Join Us" on the top-right of this screen then RSVP to events when they are posted. Members receive email notifications when new events are scheduled.


The Psychology Dinners Facebook Group

The purpose of the Psychology Dinners Facebook group is to cultivate the global citizen mindset; by enriching our perspectives through the sharing of insights before and after the events take place in our individual cities.

Click here to join the Psychology Dinners Facebook Group


For more information please visit our home page:

http://www.psychologydinners.org
results.name: New York Psychology Dinners

results.description:
We believe that programming languages, like spoken languages, require a close-knit user community in order to thrive. Scala Stammtisch is founded to bring people together who want to learn, share, and improve functional programming in Scala.

According to Wikipedia, “A Stammtisch is an informal group meeting held on a regular basis, and also the usually large, often round table around which the group meets. A Stammtisch is not a structured meeting, but rather a friendly get-together.”

We are the Scala Stammtisch of NYC, and we invite you to the table.

Format

While most technical meetups optimize for one-to-many communication, Scala Stammtisch aims for 15-to-15 discussion of technical topics.

We discuss one topic in a month’s worth of weekly meetups. Three discussions of the same material repeat on a fixed schedule each week; members should plan to attend only one of these. A fourth gathering takes place in an even less structured, and potentially raucous, setting.

The first 3 meetups for a topic will have an RSVP limit of 15. We will take attendance and no-shows will not be tolerated in the group, though members may change their RSVP with impunity from the time of the announcement up until 12pm of the day of the meetup.
results.name: Scala Stammtisch
