topics.name: Small Groups - Book Club, Discuss Issues

results.description:
"Conversations around timeless articles from weeklies and dailies and search for intelligent life among neighbors" is for people who read serious journalism in search for “the best, which has been thought and said”, and want to discuss their finds with likeminded readers.

This is an article discussion meetup for people whose main interest are books. Why article rather than book discussion group then? A book discussion group is not for people who take books seriously, i.e. “have a sense of purpose for reading” (Daniel Bell). They cannot take a detour from the reading path defined by their own questions and interests even for sake of finding people they speak the same language with. An article discussion group allows finding people of the same quality as a book group while making much lesser demand on your reading time.

A serious magazine or newspaper seems to be the only place where you can find intelligent life in public space. Good periodicals might be the only link between people who think. This is the reason for creating the meetup.

This group is for readers who from time to time come across a fascinating article and want to discuss it with others both for better understanding of things and for pleasure of being with people who share your interests.

I am talking about an occasional outstanding article with eye-opening analysis or a review of a great book (just published or classic), not about daily reporting.

For sake of describing this group I’d like to restate the obvious - a few of many things that one may get from a good newspaper if he goes past news:
1. Understanding political world we live in - insightful analysis of major issues of politics – both domestic and foreign;
2. Opportunity to hear people with greater wisdom and knowledge than your own (in our interactions in person we are usually limited to people of our own level);
3. Invaluable tips for continuing study of Humanities on your own;
4. Knowledge for dealing with earthly problems of our lives.

It is easy to miss and never discover articles and tips about books that would be of most interest to you or even “change your life” because there are too many worthy newspapers and magazines for one person to keep up with. It is another reason for this meetup.

Articles will not be limited to current ones. Selection criteria are topic and quality - publication date does not matter – we will be discussing pieces that are “timeless”.
A sample list of articles that follows this description will give you an idea of what kind of things we may discuss. People with a different range of interests who like the idea of this group may want to create meetups that reflect their interests.

Technically this group is limited to discussion of articles, but in reality it should allow discussing any topic that may interest you because over years your favorite newspapers and magazines most likely have had an article on anything you can ever think of.

Periodicals do have online forums, but they are a poor ersatz for a conversation in person and a poor tool for selecting people to talk to (before joining this meetup you will be offered a few questions to determine if the group matches your interests). Unfortunately there are no gathering places for those who want to meet people to discuss works of journalism. This group is designed to serve a role of such place.

Basics on how the group will operate
1. The leader will select an article (or a few) for a discussion using recommendations of the group and his own findings and post the selection approximately two weeks before a meeting. In addition to discussing articles we may want to share tips about articles and books that we find interesting.
2. We will restrict freedom of speech by a 2-3 min. limit per person per comment except instances when the group wants to hear more. Taking numbers might be another good idea.
3. Initial plan is to meet once a month – most likely we will be meeting on Mondays.
4. Meetings will be held in Manhattan.

Sample articles
List of abbreviations:
NYT - New Your Times
WSJ – Wall Street Journal
FT – Financial Times

0. The Truth About Our Libertarian Age By Mark Lilla - newrepublic.com June 17, 2014
1. The Slow Lane - It really is good to talk By Harry Eyres - FT, June 08, 2013
2. The Slow Lane - Peaks and Promenades By Harry Eyres - FT, September 05, 2014
3. The Slow Lane - Lessons in love from the ancients By Harry Eyres - FT, January 10, 2014
4. Daniel Bell (1919–2011) APRIL 7, 2011 Mark Lilla at nybooks.com
5. No Faith in Progress - Jonathan Franzen’s ‘Kraus Project’ - NYT Book Review, October 11, 2013
6. The Story Of a Lifetime; An ordinary German--and compulsive diarist--lives through Weimar, the Nazi era and the Cold War - WSJ, March 17, 2011
7. The Dangers of Certainty - A Lesson From Auschwitz By SIMON CRITCHLEY NYT (The Stone opinion series) February 2, 2014
8. I'm With Stupide - 'Bouvard and Pécuchet,' by Gustave Flaubert - NYT Book Review, January 22, 2006
9. The Examined Life By JONATHAN LEAR - NYT, October 25, 1998
10. Net wisdom - FT, February, 16, 2013
11. Lost and Found - Left in Nepal at 3, Daja Takes Decades To Find Out Why; After Being Raised by Monks, He Makes His Way to U.S.; 'Mother Where Are You'; A Leap From a Window Ledge - WSJ, March 15, 2005
12. Leo Strauss: The European By Mark Lilla, The New York Review of Books, Oct 21, 2004
13. Neocon or Not – Review of 'Reading Leo Strauss,' by Steven Smith – NYT Book review, June 25, 2006
14. “Salvation at the Forum” (The first Robert Bresson’s retrospective in this country in 14 years) – WSJ, January 5, 2012
15. The Crisis of American Self-Government; Harvey Mansfield on the 2012 election, and the real cost of entitlements - WSJ, December 1, 2012
16. Stoppard in Moscow - moreintelligentlife.com, November 26, 2007
17. Don't be an idiot. Read newspapers. BY TUNKU VARADARAJAN - OpinionJournal.com, April 30, 2002
18. Bad News - By RICHARD A. POSNER – NYT, July 31, 2007
19. "The Meaningfulness of Lives" – NYT (The Stone opinion series) September 11, 2011
20. Happiness, Beyond the Data By Gary Gutting - NYT (The Stone opinion series) April 10, 2013
21. When Socrates Met Phaedrus/ Eros in Philosophy - NYT (The Stone opinion series) November 3, 2013
22. "The Education of an Iranian Revolutionary" - Interview with Shirin Ebadi (Borrowing language from The Good Soldier Švejk this is another evidence that all great revolutions in history of humankind are worth shit) – WSJ, April 4, 2011
23. An Iranian Storyteller’s Personal Revolution – NYT, July 1, 2012
24. Prole Models by Charles Murray – WSJ, February 6, 2001
25. Bookshelf - The Imperialists and Their Attributes - THE RULING CASTE By David Gilmour – WSJ, February 23, 2006
26. Ian Smith, Defiant Symbol of White Rule in Africa, Is Dead at 88 – NYT, November 21
27. Merely Departed - Obits at This School Aren't to Die For; Dead King's College Alumni Can Expect a Roasting; 'Smut for its Own Sake' – WSJ, October 31, 2005
28. Notable & Quotable - Joseph Schumpeter writing about ‘the intellectual's righteous indignation about the wrongs of capitalism’ (‘Capitalism, Socialism and Democracy’) – WSJ, October 29, 2012
29. Herta Muller’s Literature, Born of Isolation – NYT, May 18, 2012
30. Why Won't They Listen? – review of The Righteous Mind by Jonathan Haidt - NYT, March 3, 2012
results.name: Conversations around timeless articles from weekliesNdailies

results.description:
The purpose of this group is share resources and practices so that we can nurture ourselves so that we have the joy and strength we need to live courageously, and so nurture others and the earth.  The group is led by LoraKim Joyner, wildlife veterinarian and minister (that's me).  My goal is to grow our numbers and commitment so that we can derive pleasure and joy from this beautiful earth, and so care for what we may, while we can. Other people and species need us to be as whole and as powerful as we can. The Conservationist Way is one pathway for this deep living and giving.  When we meet, I will facilitate specific practices and discussions to nurture ourselves so that we can nourish all of nature.

Please join if you wish to live more strongly connected to life around you, and if you wish to do something for others, such as addressing climate change, loss of biodiversity, extinction, or poverty.  If you arent' sure what you can do with limits on your energy, time and resources, do not hestiate and come join us. There are so many ways to preserve beauty on this earth, even in your daily routine.  

Everyone is welcome, because the earth needs us to be conservationists.

What is a conservationist?  It is you, or can be, for.....

A conservationist is one who increases knowledge and awareness of nature, and uses that understanding to save themselves and the world.

To find out more, go here.

Let us join one another so that our experiences and compassion can guide the way on the path of conservation and joy.
results.name: The Conservationist's Way: A Nurture Nature Group

Space Apps NYC is a New York City based, volunteer run, locally organized community of space enthusiasts originally brought together by the worldwide NASA Incubator Innovation program known as the International Space Apps Challenge. We are one of the largest and most prolific Space Apps communities on the planet, and we hold events in NYC all year long that are family-friendly, free (usually), and open to the public.

Anyone of any background or skill level who has passion for space exploration, space science, astronomy or anything outer space related (including our planet Earth!) is welcome to join us and take part in our programs. People outside of New York City are welcome to join, but please note nearly every community activity we organize will take place in the NYC metro area.
results.name: Space Apps NYC

results.description:
The PMP Exam Prep Network Meetup: 5 Boroughs/NYC Area  is for people preparing for the Project Management Institute's (PMI) Project Management Professional (PMP) application and certification test

This MeetUp is to collaborate in studying and sharing resources with other PMP exam preppers.

The MeetUp group is designed to: 

Arrange in-person study sessions (parallel study, collaborative study, etc.) 

• Parallel study: 2 or more PMP Exam Preppers meeting to study same place/time, but not necessarily collaborating (side by side study)

• Collaborative study: 2 or more PMP Exam Preppers meeting to study together 

Share PMP:

• Application preparation resources

• Study plans

• Study aids 

• Other PMP application/exam preparation support resources

Connect to any ongoing PMI and/ PMI NYC study groups/events/resources

ONGOING MEETINGS

Members can arrange meetings and announce them here on the MeetUp.  Confirm the MeetUp time and location in the days leading up to it and the day of.  This way we can grow the network and number of study session options throughout the boroughs/NYC area.

Study sessions/MeetUps should be held in public places with free wifi with excellent, reliable internet connectivity.  The best places will have the table space to accommodate members and studying and sitting for an extended period.  Libraries, community-based coworking/meeting spaces; establishments with a la carte beverage/foods with no waiter/table service and no tipping preferred (Starbucks/cafes, etc).  

Meetings: We plan to hold at least one in-person meeting per week and encourage members to host in-person study sessions at locations/times convenient to them, if they would like more options.  

Connect & Share: We will use platforms such as email, list serve, file sharing and group SMS messaging to facilitate resource sharing and setting up study sessions.

If you would like to join the PMP Exam Prep NYC area Network, send a message with:

• a description of where you are in the PMP application and exam preparation process

• your planned timeline for submitting the application and taking the PMP exam

• where you would like to have PMP study session

• resources you can share that can be of help to others in this Network.
results.name: PMP Exam Prep Network Meetup: 5 Boroughs/NYC Area

That someone that looks like him get killed every 28 hours, that will likely imprison him by his mid-thirties if he doesn't get his high school diploma, that is more than twice as likely to suspend him from school than a white classmate. results.description:
Do you like to dance? Are you interested in Scottish or Celtic music and culture? Would you like to meet great people, get some exercise, and have fun? Then come dance with us! Beginners are welcome; you don't need to bring a partner; you don't need any special costume, just soft-soled shoes with no heels and clean soles (to keep the dance floor clean -- you can change into them when you arrive).

Scottish country dancing is a social dance form where you dance with a partner in a set of couples, somewhat like square dancing or contra dancing. In each dance you will do a set of patterns using skipping steps, which are taught and practiced during the weekly classes. There are several dance parties throughout the year, as well as more formal balls in which dancers from all across the region come together and dance to live music. Each session has a break for tea and snacks during which you can rest and socialize. The dancers are very friendly and will always help you out if you get confused or forget what to do next.

Here's an example of what it looks like (and another).
results.name: Westchester Scottish Country Dance Society

INTERTWINE IS AN IDEA. The idea that wine is a social drink meant to be shared among good company. By sharing, we connect ideas, interests, form friendships and professional partnerships. Whether socially or professionally, we intertwine high-quality company with high-quality wine. Intertwine is becoming a sphere of influence among the sophisticated and the educated of New York City. Intertwine is defining the first-ever wine scene in the city that leads the world in business and pleasure. If you want to be a part of the New York wine scene, and to intertwine with all types of individuals from all genres, you must sign up to get invited to an Intertwine event.

This meetup is for people who appreciate wine and who are looking to meet others in a socially friendly atmosphere. We encourage people to get out of their comfort zone to make new friends and to simulate commerce when possible. We are a community of wine lovers but we can do much more to help each other professionally. 

We will be hosting 3 types of events:

Wine Tastings: We will be giving samples of various Italian wines at different wine shops and restaurants in New York City. Some tastings will be free and some will require a fee. 

Wine Dinners: We'll be hosting wine dinners at various restaurants and chic venues in New York that will focus on optimum wine and food pairings. These events will be exclusive and small capacity. Once an event is fully reserved, we won't be able to accept anyone else. 

Social Wine Events: These events will be social and professional networking in nature with a wine theme in the backdrop. These will be our largest events and will take place in restaurants and venues in the city. 

We are building a community of high-quality people; working professionals, entrepreneurs, business owners are all welcome. Casual wine drinkers, wine beginners, and connoisseurs are all welcome.

results.description:
Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York

This group is for Aisans, people interested in Asian culture professionally and those interested in Asian languages.


The age of this groups members is 20-40.

The group meets in Westchester, New York and occassionally in Manhattanb, New York.  We are going to have events in all major Westchester cities.  This includes;  White Plains, Yonkers, and Tarrytown.

Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York has activities for singles and families.  If an activity is for families it says (FAMILY ACTIVITY) on posting.

This is a meetup group for people in Westchester County, New York that are interested in Asian Culture and activities that are typically Asian.  Asian Culture of Westchester, New York is a New York group about Asian community and studies.  We engage in monthly activities, the majority of which are in White Plains, New York.  We do have activities planned at other Westchester, New York locations.    At least 3 times a year we are going to have an activity in Manhattan, New York.  The activities of the group are either based on Asian culture or are social events exclusively for people interested in Asian culture.  

You need to apply for membership into this group. This is to keep out unwanted people.  We do not want people joining this group simply to meet foreign women, or who are not deeply into Asian culture, but seek meager entertainment.  This group is for people who are members of the Asian community.  You do not have to be Asian to join this group.  This is a group for people who are seriously interested in Asian culture and Asians!  We do no permit people who are voyeurs or who do not take the groups subject matter seriously.  Please do not let this discourage you.  This is a security measure to allow us to have a high quality and more productive group.


The activities of this group include:

Asian Bar Nights

Asian Nightclub Nights

Asian Social Networking Events

Asian History Discussions

Asian Religious Discussions

Chinese New Year Celebrations

The Spring Blossom Festival

Kabuki Theatre

Karaoke

Asian Movie Viewing Nights

Visiting Koreatown.

Visiting Flushings Chinatown

Visiting Manhattan's Chinatown and Canal Street.

Visiting Manhattan, New York fir Asian culture events.

Visiting Buddhist Temples and Shrines

Lectures on Asian Culture

Asian Language Exchanges

The group meets every month.

Tet Celebration

The group is lead by a native New Yorker, who is a Buddhist/Taoist instructor and martial arts teacher.  The organizer is also an active member of the Asian community in; New York and Hawaii.  The organizer enjoys; Asian clubs in New York, karaoke, surfing, and the arts.


Thank you,

Erik

The Asian Culture in Westchester New York Meetup Organizer
results.name: Asian Society and Culture in Westchester, New York Meetup

results.description:
The Young Professionals Network of Fairfield County (YPN) is an initiative of The Business Council of Fairfield County that for professionals in their 20s and 30s who work and live throughout the region. Our job is to enrich the community by providing business, networking, and volunteer opportunities to support your career development, and to promote the qualities that make Fairfield County a great place for young professionals to live, work, and put down roots.

Since 2009, YPN has connected Fairfield County's young professionals with the region's business leadership; looked at some of the most exciting places throughout the county; volunteered at clothing drives, urban farms, and more to give back to the local community; and partnered with local business and other young professional organizations to develop and celebrate tomorrow's leaders, today. We look forward to seeing you soon at our events. Welcome to the Young Professionals Network of Fairfield County!

results.description:
(best viewed in desktop version).

A sketch group for nudist male artists where artists take turns posing for each other. Our focus is to draw the male figure and depict masculinity in an open-minded, sex-positive nature not found in traditional drawing groups. When both the model and the artist are similarly naked, they are on equal footing, encouraging openness and camaraderie. Sex or touching is not allowed except that sessions may include homoerotic poses; please read the details and FAQ below. Website http://mndgny.com

Criteria to join this group:

• individuals who primarily present themselves with masculine or male features, including transgendered men

• visual artist (mandatory, any level from beginner to experienced), all non-smelly mediums except photography. Since we pose for each other, we don't accept guys who only want to pose. 

• comfortable being nude with fellow artists, willing to pose naked for other artists (see FAQ re erotic poses)

• friendly, respectful

• photo in profile (headshot/face preferred)

• be local or have plans to travel to NYC


Additional details and rules:

•  We meet about 3 times per month, usually a Tuesday, a Thursday and one weekend day. Please check the schedule.

•  Multiple locations. Address given to members only.

•  RSVP via Meetup only.

•  Fee: $15 cash. Credit cards accepted for advance payment. Use link in the event description.

•  Arrive 15-30 minutes before event start time. Everyone sets up. 

•  Overall session time is 3 hours. It’s a 2-1/2 hour drawing session with a little social time before.  Everyone cleans up after.

•  Full nudity of all participants is required for the duration of the session. Tuesday venue: footwear is recommended when not on the model stand.

•  All artists should be willing to pose on the model stand. First-timers are not required to pose. There are usually more artists than posing slots so not everyone will pose. Sign up for single/duo/3-person poses. Erotic/sensual/sexualized poses on the model stand welcome (see FAQ below re erotic poses).

•  Creating interesting poses is the group’s collective responsibility. Each artist should think about his possible poses in advance while the other artists should offer friendly suggestions. 

•  There is no instruction. Bring all your own materials, drawing boards, portable easels, etc. There is a sink available for rinsing your brushes.

•  Artists are encouraged to share their work by taping their work to the wall as the session progresses. If you are drawing in a notebook, please share them with whoever is taking the artwork photos at the session. We will photograph drawings to post on social media. We want this to be social (not formal). While we want to improve our artwork, we want to have fun doing it. Don't forget to take your drawings home with you!

•  Photography of persons without permission is prohibited.

•  Sexual activity (other than as part of a pose) is prohibited anywhere in the building. While we are a sex-positive group, this is not a hook-up event.

•  Bring a towel or sit on your shirt. Please be hygienic.

•  Bring a backpack or bag to put your stuff in (wallet, phone, etc). MNDGNY or the venues are not responsible for lost or stolen items.

•  First-time artists must sign a form allowing (or not allowing) us to publish photos of their artwork done during the session on the group’s sites and social media. Our default is to post artwork only without any identification. It's okay to decline but still fill out a form.


Priority RSVP and "no-show" policy:

To reward regular attendance and reduce “no-shows”, we are implementing priority RSVPs similar to airline priority seating. To attend a session, everyone must first join the waitlist. RSVPs will be confirmed by group (Goldstar, Fan, NewlyJoined all). http://www.meetup.com/Mens-Naked-Drawing-Group-NY/pages/Priority_RSVP_and_no-show_policy


Volunteer roles (this is a group effort):

• Bring bring snacks/refreshments to share (optional). Wine, seltzer, crackers provided.

• Photographing artwork

• Music (bring your device, your playlist, hook into the sound system)

• Thinking of interesting poses – all artists

• Setting up and cleaning up


FAQ:

•  I don't know how to draw. Is there any instruction? There is no instruction, but beginner artists are welcome to try us out as long as you have the interest and make the effort to draw. There will be special sessions with instruction from a naked teacher; please check the schedule.

•  I've never been to a naked event before. What's it like? We're a friendly bunch and nonjudgmental. We have a wide range of ages and body types. There are usually about 20 artists. Everyone gets fully undressed (except for footwear depending on venue) after checking in/paying the fee and stays naked for the entire session. It's quite natural and relaxed. However, unlike a typical, strictly non-sexual naturist activity, there IS some sexual energy. Please read the entire FAQ.

•  Do I need to bring my own supplies? What is provided? You must bring all your own supplies (paper/pads, pencils, drawing boards, easels, etc). Most guys draw on pads on their laps. The studio provides chairs, and running water.

•  I've never posed before. Many of our members had never posed before joining our group. We're a friendly and relaxed group, so no need to stress out about it. It might be easier to pose together with someone else to start. We have 2-person poses to accommodate this. First-timers are encouraged to but are not required to pose. Not everyone poses every session. We have about 10 posing slots per session. There is a sign-up sheet for poses (varying lengths 5-20mins) at the beginning of each session.

•  What's an erotic pose? Poses are up to each artist posing. We're a naked drawing group where erotic poses are welcome but not required. They can be classical, athletic, dance-like, sexy, etc. Erotic/sexualized poses can simulate sexual acts like masturbating, etc. We're open-minded but don't move too much. It's not a performance piece. If you drip, etc. please wipe off the model stand. Each venue has different guidelines on what's acceptable - this will be announced before each session.

• Is this a gay group? Many of our members are gay, but we are open to men regardless of sexual orientation. In fact, we don't talk about it much. However, some artists create poses that are homoerotic/sexualized so you should be comfortable with that.

• What's the sexual energy of the group like? The sexual energy level varies quite a bit depending on who shows up.

What if I get an erection? Erections are natural and are welcome. However, when you're socializing or supposed to be drawing, masturbating is not okay.

• Who keeps the drawings that I posed for? Each artist keeps his own drawings. The model can ask for/trade/buy other artists' drawings.


Organized by Shungaboy

Our social media:

Our Website: http://mndgny.com...

Our Twitter: https://twitter.com/M...

Our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook....

Our Wordpress Blog: http://mndgny.wordpre...


Updated 11/7/2015
results.name: Men's Naked Drawing Group NY

results.description:
When the schedule says a start time it doesn't mean you have to be there at the specified start time. you can arrange to come at any point from start time to 8 pm. Saturday & Sunday activities are available all day long not just starting at 9 am. Just say you will be attending for the day and tell me what time you plan to show up than watch for my confirmation reply. If you have my text # already you can contact me via text as well but please if you can also show attendance on this site if you can't I totally understand it can get tedious signing in at this site for every class. I've experienced it myself attending other people's meetups. I'm Rob by name. Adrenalhigh Rob or Sergeant Pain if you prefer. :-) Now for the information about this training.

This group will include outdoor martial arts training and outdoor social sports in NYC & BK as well as indoor martial arts training on rainy and cold days in Brooklyn.

All training and sports will be on a first request basis. Whomever requests whichever activity on any given day / time is what we will do.

Tennis & Paddle Ball 

For tennis I will bring 100 balls and we will do drills first than play a game than review our weaknesses and drill our weaknesses. There will be no charge for this unless you need to borrow a racquet than it will be a $5 charge for racquet rental.

Social & Competitive Volleyball & Badminton:
Coming soon

Martial Arts:

Though martial arts classes show starting at a specific time you can arrive at any time from the start time to as late as 8 pm. Just let me know what time you plan to arrive. However, it's always preferred you come at the beginning of a session.

I've been doing Martial Arts since very young and am over 40 now. We will cover the following.

Wing Chun

Muay Thai

BJJ-Brazilian Jiu Jitsu

Hung Ga

Choy Lay Fut

Philippine Stick Fighting

Traditional European Fencing-Not Olympic style but the style used to actually fight / defend yourself.

Chinese Broad Sword

Japanese Sword

Traditional European Fencing

Pole

Spear

Chain Whip

Chi Gung

Tai Chi

Heavy Weapons from SCA / Rennaissance.

This is no joke. I've been doing all of these and more for at least 4 years each up to 20 years for some. Each class will be only $5 for up to 4 hours of training a day. For training in NYC you'll need to bring your own gear if you come to Brooklyn you can use my gear. Please bring the exact amount I won't always have change.

Why am I doing this?

Just to keep my skills sharp. So come and get it if you like a challenge and becoming fit and skilled. Some training will be outdoors on favorable weather days . Otherwise I have a heated garage we will use. I have every weapon you can possibly imagine we'll be using, A Muk Jong / Wooden man and full body protection for at least two people so starting out. As well as kettle bells, lat pull down system, flexibility training devices, elastic bands & iron body conditioning systems. For the colder times of the year come dressed for chilly but not cold temperature and on day 1 you'll see what you will need or may want to get in the future. 

What we train in for the day will be based on who makes the initial training request and a majority preference. 

Don't worry I've done this before and it works out well. 

Before your first class please send me a direct email that you want to attend and what time and where.  For the winter all training will be in Brooklyn, Bensonhurst, D Train to 18th Ave. In the summer trainings will occur either in BK or NYC based on individual request.

On day 1 we'll have to arrange the meeting time so I can come get you. After day 1 you'll be able to come at any point. 

NOTE WHEN I DID THIS BEFORE THERE ARE ALWAYS PEOPLE WHO SAY THEY ARE COMING BUT DON"T SHOW UP. NO SHOWS WITHOUT NOTIFICATION WILL NOT BE ABLE TO CONTINUE. I OFFER A THREE STRIKE POLICY

This is a group for parents  of biracial or African American children who strive to offer their children the best advantages in life.Sometimes, this results in our children not having many representations of themselves on a day to day basis. Parents of trans-racially adopted children are also welcome.


This group is to serve as a place for us parents to discuss ways to keep our children grounded and secure in their identity despite being part of a minority in their home and/or academic environment . Eventually, we will share events where the children will see others like themselves in a casual atmosphere i.e . arts activities( Alvin Ailey, Museum trips etc. ), Park picnics, sports, philanthropy  etc. Of course, sometimes , moms want to just unwind with a chat and a laugh and we'll have some of that too!


If you appreciate the idea behind J&J but not the hurdles then you should be right at home!
results.name: Moms  of  Biracial or Af Am Children

results.description:
The mission of New Jersey Screenwriters is to provide formal tools to established and aspiring screenwriters alike while also fostering a sense of community and mutual learning that engenders friendship, fellowship and the potential to create marketable products. This community provides opportunities for writers to acquire or hone a variety of skills, from character development, structure and formatting to pitching. Peer to peer feedback will be a routine aspect of each meeting along with career guidance from industry professionals. Affording opportunities to network both personally and professionally is a foundation of this organization. This is accomplished through the following types of monthly events: - Writing Workshops: We bring in industry professionals for hands-on sessions where you can learn new techniques and skills to improve your work. - Feedback Opportunities and Pitching Practice: You will have many opportunities to present in front of your peers in order to gain exposure and gather feedback. - Networking Events: Meet other writers, actors, directors, producers, and other industry professionals to explore and form new collaborations. - Film Screenings: We curate films based on the group's interest to stimulate and facilitate group discussion and learning. - Guest Speaker Series: We invite active industry professionals who will share their experiences, insights, and advice. The programming of this group and the nature of the support will grow and align with the needs of New Jersey Screenwriters (NJS) members.


Keep up with us in our Google Community: https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/104069023001226753586
results.name: New Jersey Screenwriters

Bringing the Record Home

A great Hanukkah event will soon happen here in our community. Welcome to the NYC chapter of Enough4All! We're a group of creative people who care about changing the world for the better. We host events that highlight the intersection of the arts/media/creativity and social transformation, including live interviews and happy hour mixers. If you're interested in social change and believe in the power of art and creativity to inspire, you can meet like-minded thinkers and creators at our Meetup events!

About Enough4All: We bring together creative people from all over the world to inspire the wider public around the theme "enough for all." Through the work of artists and other creative people, we hope to amplify the voice of those in need. Our community is both physical and virtual (enough4all.org). 

Facebook: http://facebook.com/enough4all
Twitter: http://twitter.com/enough4all
YouTube: http://youtube.com/enough4allofficial

results.description:
Mobile First is now the mantra of every corporation. Customers and employees expect system access from any device, anywhere and at any time. There is an increasingly rich ecosystem of apps, to the delight of their consumers. Corporations are now expecting their IT and Security departments will deliver the flexibility and user experience that mobility promises, but on BYOD with the data and security protections policy demands, and all at a cost that is manageable.

This challenge is now broader than what has been addressed through “traditional” Mobile Device Management or mobile application development. Microsoft's has developed an approach that brings together hybrid identity, information rights management and mobile and applications management, to deliver an Enterprise Mobility service.

This meetup group is an opportunity to discuss and contribute to this rapidly evolving sector and the Microsoft Enterprise Mobility capabilities. We anticipate it being supported by Microsoft, customers, partners and industry personnel alike.
results.name: Microsoft Enterprise Mobility New York
